0.user_question: On Monday the post office delivered 8890433 letters. On Tuesday they delivered 17 more than one-fifth as many as Monday. On Wednesday they delivered 5 more than twice as many as they delivered on Tuesday. How many letters did the post office deliver Monday - Wednesday?

ost_step.1: Post offices delivery for Monday was 8890433 letters.
ost_step.2: Letters received on tuesday= (1/5) * monday’s count +17 i.e.,(1/5)*8890433+17 which equals 1778086.6 or approximately 1778087 if we round it off since number of letter can not be fractional hence rounded upwards .
ost_step.3: Number of letters delivered on wednedays= (twice*Tuesdays count)+5=(2*1778087)+5 =  3556179 let us assume that only whole numbers exist so disregard any decimal values. Hence our calculation becomes exactly same without approximation -> (2*1778087)+5 = 3556179
ost_step.4: Total_letters_delivered over three days = sum_of_(Monday ,tuesday ,wednedsay)=monday's count+(tuesdays count)+Wednessday'scount => 8890433 +1778087+3556179 = 14225700

so         Wednesday'count=(2*1778087)+5       so      WD_total=TwiceAmountOnTuesday+FiveMoreItems                           i.e.,              WD_Total          =           2*(TWoAMountONTUESDAY)             +       5more              ≈                =                +      5 More Items                → WD_Total≅             =   TwiceItemSTwomoreAddedSoNowADUsed@HintsFor
